title.narrative: 217170 3UN UNICEF Afghanistan Crises Affected Children Return to Public Schools

description.narrative: GPE School Support Interventions: The proposed project aims to support 87,500 children in 175 public schools to safely start and continue schooling in Ghor Province (Firoz Koh, Pasaband, Shahrak and Dolaina) districts. WV will support targeted public schools with hygien materials, drinking and handwashing water aims to enhance hygiene practices among the students and school principals/staff. With months of suspension of education activities, students having been away from learning, so catch up and supplementary classes will be provided to at least half of the students as extra teaching hours during the day. WV will hire 175 new teachers who will be allocated to in-need schools after an assessment. New teachers will receive the EiEWG ToT Manual training on child protection, teaching methodologies, classroom management and basic psyc-social support for a duration of 14 days. Moreover, a total of 1,750 teachers (10 per school) will be trained on students assessments and conducting summative and formative assessment to improve their capacity in order to run the catch up classes.
